ix.iface.ui
Class HTMLPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  ix.iface.ui.HTMLPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener
public class HTMLPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener

A panel with a type-in box, open-button, and a scrollable JEditorPane for HTML.

Example code for using the HTMLPanel: 


    ...
    frame.getContentPane().setLayout(new BorderLayout(0,0));
    HTMLPanel htmlPanel = new HTMLPanel(fileName);
    getContentPane().add(BorderLayout.CENTER, htmlPanel);
    ...
For a real example @see ix.iface.ui.HelpFrame

See Also:

Field Detail

mostRecentMouseEvent

java.awt.event.MouseEvent mostRecentMouseEvent
Constructor Detail

HTMLPanel

public HTMLPanel()
Puts up a panel with a text-field and a button at the top and a scrollable text area underneath. The text area can display HTML (including images), follow links when clicked, and select text, but NOT edit. The text-field is for typing in a URL reference, the button (or return) will open the page into the text area.

HTMLPanel

public HTMLPanel(java.net.URL url)
As above but the given URL is displayed and remembered as the original page.

HTMLPanel

public HTMLPanel(java.lang.String fileName)
As above but the given file name is converted to a URL using the html area of the resources. An example call is HTMLPanel("ide-help.html") <\code>

Method Detail

currentURL

public java.net.URL currentURL()

displayURL

public boolean displayURL(java.net.URL url)
Displays the given URL in the text area. Keeps track of previous url for "back" buttons. Will remove forward stack. Also shows a wait cursor while it is displaying.

back

public boolean back()

forward

public boolean forward()

hyperlinkUpdate

public void hyperlinkUpdate(javax.swing.event.HyperlinkEvent e)
Gets called when a link is clicked in the current page. Use this to implement following links. The events seem to be of type "ACTIVATED". Other types are ENTERED and EXITED but I don't know what they are!

Specified by:
hyperlinkUpdate in interface javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener

loadFromURL

protected boolean loadFromURL(java.net.URL url)
